intro: Agapetes pachyacme, commonly known as the thickstemmed fairy bell, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and densely arranged along the stems. Agapetes pachyacme thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in cloud forests at high elevations.
